Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jabaldo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another family while visiting the island. It was perfect for what we wanted. Inexpensive clean with a friendly staff. Nothing fancy but comfortable for all. There is even a pool that was cleaned daily and hardly used. Good choice for families.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Vieques-feel Lodging w Great View!”
Reviews.Author: Jake D
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Crow's next and would definitely go back! It's a little more difficult to find a place for only 2 nights in Vieques, but they were very accommodating and we had a great room for a great price that didn't break the bank. Some have given negative reviews, but those cheapos need to realize that if they want Ritz-Carlton rooms they'll need to pay for them. There were a few mosquitoes we had to squash, but you're in a tropical climate, so for the price I thought it was well worth it, and I liked the adventurous feel it provided. It's nicely secluded about half-way in between Isabel Segunda & Esperanza. Ample parking, beautiful grounds, great pool area where they serve the continental breakfast, and a spectacular view!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: martinw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Crow's Nest during the holiday period, December 2011. However, after just one night we decided to move on as the standard of accommodation fell well below our expectations.Â  Our family room had poor quality, tired, old furniture and very uncomfortable beds. The ageing air conditioner was incredibly noisy and when switched off we were disturbed by the other noisy units in the surrounding rooms and restaurant.Â  The tiny bathroom had an ancient suite with a blocked shower head. The toilet was so close to the sink that it wasn't possible to stand properly at the sink or open the cupboard door beneath. There was evidence of rodent infestation - large droppings on the windowsill and gnaw marks - which led us to re-name the hotel 'The Rat's Nest'. On the positive side, the rooms and bedding were quite clean (aside from the droppings). There is a pool with excellent views over the garden and surrounding countryside. The restaurant seemed popular and was busy in the evening. There was free wifi - which we used to find another hotel! The Crow's Nest is budget-style accommodation but not at a budget price. Â We expected a lot better for the money.Â

Reviews.Title: “small, secluded, quiet”
Reviews.Author: WaiPRUSA
Reviews.Content: This small, secluded and quiet hotel (inn) is located on a hill about 12 to 15 minutes from the island ferry terminal. Once you get there the hotel lobby is located right in front of it. The hotel employees were nice and welcoming. We had a few questions from the island beaches and they where very kind to answer them. We stayed in the second floor on a room with balcony. It was pretty clean, although it could've been cleaner. We were there for 3 nights and had planed to go to the beach, but decided to stay at the pool almost every day. It as so relaxing! A few places that we went to where: The Bioluminescent Bay (a most see only during the night), about 10 to 15 minutes from the hotel. The "Fortin Conde de Mirasol", about 12 minutes away. "Red Beach". Now, it's used to be very difficult to get to "Red Beach", but now its a lot better, and it will take you about 20 minutes to get there. But believe me it's worth it! Oh, and one last thing. The view that we got of the island from this hotel was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “So sad to see it's decline...”
Reviews.Author: tignale
Reviews.Content: I have always had fond memories of the Crow's Nest as a quaint, serene, and affordable place to stay in Vieques. I had stayed there three times previous to my most recent trip in July. I was very to sad to see that it was no longer maintained and serviced like it once was. The once lush foliage is now dead. The buildings are chipping paint and wood is rotting. The yummy breakfast of fresh juice, tropical fruit and pastries once was served on the second floor of an open deck with an almost tree-house feel, but now it is served in cheap plastic chairs next to the pool consisting of only cereal, bread, and concentrated juice. We brought our own mangos to breakfast the next day. Service once was stellar and attentive-- coolers, beach chairs, snorkeling equipment was always available. Now, you have to scramble to scrounge up your own chairs and share the one mask that they have left. The front desk used to arrange the bio tours and cars before arriving, but now that is all left to the guest. I had raved about how wonderful it once was, but upon arrival, I realized things had changed. I was embarrassed bringing my boyfriend and best friend there. We discovered that it has been for sale for four years, and I suppose the owners decided to no longer invest in its upkeep and service. It's worth $50 a night, but sadly, we paid $125 as we did not know that it declined so much. I really did love this place once, but sadly it is not what it once was...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay, will certainly return!”
Reviews.Author: karlara
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my yearly summer vacation, which for the last five years I've spent at The Crow's Nest in Vieques. The Front Desk staff is as friendly and accomodating as ever, making us up-to-date about the new restaurants and places to visit. It was raining most of the time, which was a bummer. Rain brings the mosquitoes out, it doesn't matter where you are. You should see San Juan, where I live! At any rate, the Crow's Nest's gardens were flush with flowers, making the grounds as lovely as I remember them. The cleaning staff is extremely accomodating, but my room was spotless. The only negative thing I saw was the pool. It looks as if it the water is dirty, but the head of maintenance explained that they are just spots and that the water is clean, which indeed it was. He explained that plans are to resurface the pool but he has to wait until the summer is over, otherwise there would be riots from the guests who come every year. The location of the hotel, smack in the center of the island, is perfect for exploring, and the price can't be beat. I will keep coming as long as they let me!

Reviews.Title: “I do not return”
Reviews.Author: Arandela
Reviews.Content: This hotel could benefit from better mantenance. The exterior looked abandoned. I stayed with a group and shared a room with a colleague. Our room was very deteriorated (ceiling and walls were peeling off and had signs of water leaks, screens had holes through which mosquitos could come into the room), dirty (mold in bathroom, very dusty), and the worst was that when we uncovered the bed we found hair and a dead insect. We requested a room change and the only offer was a room with deteriorated appliances, hot and dusty. They offered to clean everything and they did but first they told me I could not be expecting a perfect room. The management even did not believe what I said about the beds that looked as never been changed. They came to the room to inspect and then they apologized. But first they did not believe me. I told them I was not asking for a perfect room but for a room in the minimal decent conditions for a person to stay and feel safe and relaxed. I found another dead insect when I uncovered the bed after they cleaned. The hotel is located in a very nice area (nature as its best) but away from the city (you need transportation to go around). The restaurant in the hotel was superb. You have to eat there. The hotel included a continental breakfast that had very few choices and variety per day. There was a very nice pool but it needed better cleaning. The view from the pool and dining areas was spectacular. Unfortunately one day when two of us served our cereal we found that it had "gorgojos" or food insects. It was disgusting. My experience there was more negative than positive. At this point and based on the bad memories I feel I do not want to stay in the hotel never again. The property is for sale. It seems to me that the owner is not interested in keeping the hotel in decent and acceptable conditions. To be fair, some of the people who traveled with me said they got nice rooms. But other people complained of their rooms too. In one room there was a tarantula in the bathroom. In a few rooms there were too many mosquitoes.. We were told that this is a hotel in the "campo" (inland) and it is to be expected that insects get into the rooms. I disagreed with that standpoint.

Reviews.Title: “colorful, island style”
Reviews.Author: Thysanoessa
Reviews.Content: simple, functional, room with a lanai and views of grounds, ocean and pool. room had a kitchenette. a wonderful restaurant next door. we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “good basic accomodations on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: tepirby
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Crow's Nest was nothing spectacular but it fully met our needs. Pros: The staff is very friendly, there was a nice continental breakfast every morning, the pool and grounds were lovely and there is a very good little rooftop restaurant on site. There was beach gear available for free (umbrellas, chairs, etc). I also felt like it attracted a good mix of friendly people because of the price point...older couples who had been coming there for years, other young couples, some solo travelers and some families...so there was a pleasant, laid-back vibe. Cons: The rooms are pretty dated and bugs fairly present, bed a little lumpy (then again, I was 4 months pregnant so I might have been particularly sensitive!), and the location is tricky if you don't have a rental car as it is neither in town nor on the beach. A NOTE ABOUT RENTAL CARS ON THE ISLAND: they can be VERY hard to get ...if you don't have one already reserved don't wait until you get there as you will be out of luck! We even met several people who DID have one reserved and were still unable to get one when they arrived. The hotel tried to help us in the days leading up to our visit and while we were there but even she could find one. I have heard this may have improved with the W's arrival on the island but I wouldn't risk it. The island is very hilly so bikes probably aren't going to be a good option and the walk into town or to the beach is too far (and my husband and I are both very active and fit). We were lucky and were able to find some scooters to rent at the last minute, so if you're up for that check out the rental place down on the malecon.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay on the Island.”
Reviews.Author: TC7823
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Crows Nest for over 20 years now. This year our daughter got married there - and we had over 20 friends flown in for the ceremony. We must say this was one of those "life memory" moments. The services provided by the staff, especially Liz ODell the Restaurant Owner/Manager, were simply wonderful. The food was superb (one of the guests was a Chef from Key West and he loved the island, the Crows Nest, and the food - he actually took several recipies back with him). Everyone who came vowed they would return to this beautiful, quiet, and pristine Guest House - and we're already planning a "reunion" for everyone next year. I would highly recommend the Crows Nest to ANYONE wanting a quiet and beautiful getaway. For a quick overview of the Crows Nest - you can go to www.crowsnestvieques.com. My wife and I are already planning our semi-annual trip back down in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe Their WebSite-Read This”
Reviews.Author: MarshalDillon1
Reviews.Content: The reason for the title of my review is very simple, the website is outright misleading. It doesn't lie, it just doesn't tell the truth. The website gives the impression that a regular room is extra large with a sofa, easy chair, and lots of room. This is false. Aparently, this is the larger 2 room suite, not the regular room. Also, they have TV in the room with cable, which is true but again it's misleading. The TV gets like 10 channels, with 2 channels broadcast twice. What you really have is 8 channels, like Fox News, CNN, ESPN, TBS, HBO, TMC (I think), and ABC, CBS, & NBC. Now, some the good stuff. Christina, the girl at the front desk is super. She's very sweet, speaks fluent Spanish & English (she's Anglo). She will jump through hoops to be helpful. The inn is located away from town so make sure he have either a car or a scooter. The AC was good in our room on the 2nd floor. There is a pool and restaurant, but the food is pricey and portions small. Oure room was large with a full kitchenette including a stove, microwave, large refrigerator, and cabinet space. We had a table for eating on with 3 hard chairs. The bathroom is bigger than average for a hotel/inn with a large shower. I would recommend this place to others with the proviso they understand what they are getting instead of the website "errors." Vieques is a neat place to visit with beautiful beaches, a U.S. Natural preserve, horseback riding, fishing, snorkeling, hiking, plenty of places to hang out and eat or drink.

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: Gretchy
Reviews.Content: The Crow's Nest is a charming place to stay. Comfortable, spacious rooms - not fancy at all, but felt very homey. The staff was really friendly, and kept our room extremely clean on a daily basis. Loved the breakfast area - fantastic setting overlooking the pool, hillside, and ocean in the distance - and enjoyed the simple breakfast, passionfruit juice and great coffee every morning. Roosters crowing in the middle of the night were a little annoying, yet kind of funny, but shutting the windows and cranking up the a/c around 4am helped a lot. Liked the use of beach towels and beach coolers, and took advantage of the gatorade and water for sale in the office on a daily basis!

Reviews.Title: “Cute inn with a beautiful view and nice rooms for large families.”
Reviews.Author: pedalmom
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the two adjoining rooms for our family of 5 that were priced very reasonably for the amount of space that included kitchenettes in each room and a huge patio across the front of both rooms. The inn provided an extremely basic continental breakfast that was a little disappointing day after day. While we were there, the restaurant was only open one evening, but the food there was quite good when it was open. We ran into several families there for the holiday weeks who have been coming to this inn for many years, so obviously the service is good and the nearby beaches are wonderful, with restaurants available in the two little towns on the island. We ourselves would probably not return to this inn, at least at the holidays, due to a great deal of party noise throughout the nights from nearby locations off the inn property. Also, although the roosters are charming, they started crowing around 3 in the morning, right about the time the partying ended. Although we could of course sleep on the beach each day, we were pretty tired by the time we left this inn!

Reviews.Title: “Hot, Sweaty, Buggy - Avoid Room 105”
Reviews.Author: SandyPantsKK
Reviews.Content: I had heard that the lower level rooms are not good - I'd like to confirm. Avoid staying in room 105. It's a hot, muggy room with an ineffective AC, a ceiling fan that rattles and barely any privacy. Not relaxing, restful or romantic at all. It's located on a footpath that gets lots of foot traffic, starting in the early morning with chatty guests and staff. You can hear every word while in room 105. Ventillation at windows must be shut in order to have visual privacy. Accomodation and decor of room 105 is Soviet Style (uninspired). The room has a little kitchen area with some pots and utensils. Bathroom is a dank sweatpit - insects love it. We had to have two Raid fumigation treatments in the hotel room during our brief stay and needed to spray bug repellent prior to bedtime to avoid bites. However, staff is friendly and helpful. The ability to use the beach towels, beach chairs and coolers was very convenient for visiting the beaches of Vieques. Location is good for driving to all that Vieques has to offer. A rental car facility is located next door, which was nice and easy. Crow's Nest was a $10 cab ride to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn09
Reviews.Content: All - there are some gambles on Vieques; spend a lot get a little, spend a little get even less, etc. The Crow's Nest is a relatively safe bet. My wife and I just returned from a four night stay and here is my review. The staff was more than accomodating, the rooms were completely adequate, the view and pool were ok, breakfast was a little lacking (but included with the room). All and all, for the money, I would definately recommend the crows nest for the value that it offers. For the $145/night rate, you should first base your appraisal on the fact that on the island everything costs just a little more than usual. So, the rate gets you a pretty decent room in a quiet part of the island. Esperanza is tiny, but it does draw the night life crowd. The nest is far enough from that to give you exactly what vieques offers in abundance, tranquility. Also, the hotel is situated equi-distant from Isabel segundo and Esperanza, making it easy to go to either with a simple right or left turn out if the parking lot. One bug thing to point out: almost no other hotels offer television on the island. I know, I know, you might think that TV isn't why you went on vacation, but after a long day in the sun, it is actually nice to put on HBO and let the sleepies take over. Listen, I'm sure there are nicer places, but truth be told, The Crow's Nest is a very nice 'local' feeling place with charm and a very nice staff. Beds were clean and comfortable, even with my wife's back problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchaoir users beware”
Reviews.Author: abh123456
Reviews.Content: Yes, the people who run the hotel are very nice. Yes, the view from the pool is very pretty. But I don't know why anyone would choose to stay at this hotel when there are so many beautiful hotels, for the same price, RIGHT ON THE BEACH. I selected Crow's Nest because I use a wheelchair, and they said they had a wheelchair accessible room. It was NOT accessible. They had to take the bathroom door down so that I could squeeze through (I am not a large woman, my chair is only 24 inches wide). There were no grab bars in the bathroom, and the shower had a large lip. They had put a plastic pool chair into the shower because I had requested a shower chair. I am appalled they call themselves accessible. The Puerto Rican Tourism bureau also has them listed as an accessible hotel, and I will be contacting to let them know this is not accurate. Our room had a run-down kitchen in it, which was nice to boil some eggs, but we had to wash every plate and pot before we used them because they were so dirty. They do give out beach towels, that was nice, but I just read some other reviews saying the hotel had beach chairs - I wish I had know that, but they never told us about them! There are so many other lovely places to stay (I wish we had known ahead of time) - like Blue Horizon, which is wheelchair accessible, or Hector's By the Sea, which has just one step into their rooms, and I will stay in those places next time.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay elsewhere on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: hezzaah
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crow's Nest three times, both before and after the opening of Il Jardin (the "new" Bar/Grill casual restaurant). I'm actually SHOCKED that someone reported poor customer service. Both my family and friends of ours are repeat customers and from my first visit found the owners and staff friendly and accommodating. Regarding the opening of Il Jardin - the owners DID receive complaints regarding noise right after the opening and IMMEDIATELY took action to resolve these complaints. By our visit shortly after opening, they actively stopped serving and tried to have the area quiet by 9pm for the hotel guests. Unlike many Carribean properties, you will find that many Crow's Nest employees have been with the property for years. The gentleman who served our dinner during year one had promoted and planned an AMAZING New Year's menu during year three. Anyway. Yes, the rooms are not new and not what you would find at the resort. Still, they are comfortable and clean, have stove/refrig/microwave/cable/AC. The hotel provides beach chairs, coolers and ice, and a continental breakfast.. Snacks and water are available for purchase in the office. What else do you need on an island where you will spend 90% of your time at the beach?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: budgeting
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how many amenities our room had - microwave, fridge, sink+cabinets+kitchen utensils, lovely bathroom, breakfast table, and amazing balcony. All the rooms are well ventilated and guests wake up to the sound of roosters - all in all, a very lovely and tranquil spot of paradise. The only thing to complain of is that the restaurant at the guest house is a bit pricey (average price for a dinner for 2 is around $80 including tips), but in general, all meals in Vieques are a bit overpriced for being of average quality. The guest house does offer a complimentary continental breakfast, though, and this was always nicely prepared and guests are treated to fresh juice such as passion fruit. Be aware that if you stay at Crow's Nest, or anywhere in Vieques for that matter, you have to get a car! They go for about $50/day not including insurance ($10-15/day). With a car, virtually anywhere on the island can be reached in less than 20 minutes. Without car, you have to taxi it or get a bike, and both are unreliable - there are very few taxis on Vieques and the weather is a bit unpredictable because it drizzles w/o warning. 1/3 of the roads are dirt, so there may be washouts or other routes unfit for walking or biking. Cars are the way to go, and I recommend reserving it before you even book a room because the vehicles are much harder to come by.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, pleasant place to stay in Vieques”
Reviews.Author: KW_NC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crow's Nest last week with my boyfriend and another couple. We had two adjacent rooms (7a, 7b) with a kitchenette and a living room area. We found this a very pleasant, friendly guest house in a great location. The rooms themselves were very clean, but getting a little shabby in some places (the kitchen counter was damaged and the bathroom needed painting). For the price, I thought it was a very good value. The larger room (7A) had a TV and phone, but 7B did not. Both rooms had refrigerators. We had a small patio outside the room where we could sit outside and enjoy the weather. We were very close to the pool, which is surrounded by a nicely landscaped yard and has a beautiful view. One of the best things about the Crow's Nest is that it is small enough that it feels very private. We were very often the only guests at the pool or in the restaurant for breakfast, and the times we did meet the other guests, they were nice and willing to trade recommendations for places to eat and good beaches. The Crow's Nest provides beach towels, umbrellas, chairs and snorkel gear, so you don't have to bring those items with you. They have wireless access onsite (I didn't use it). I saw several people with laptops out around the patio area, so it must have worked well. The Crow's Nest is located in the north, central part of Vieques, with easy access to Isabel Segunda and Esperanza, as well as most beaches. We ate breakfast every day in the outdoor restaurant (continental is free, but they will cook a breakfast for $8). We ate at the Island Restaurant one evening and thought it was expensive, but good, with high quality steaks. We really liked the Crow's Nest because of the peace and quiet and friendly service. You will have to get used to the sound of coquis (tree frogs) and roosters, but I found it a very nice place to stay in Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “the worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: yeye33
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m from PR and I have to say, the customer service in this â€œhotelâ€� was poor, after a day to get there, they cancel my reservation with not reason and the manager after this, treat us like nobody, so I decide to come back to Luquillo and stay in Westin Rio Mar, and I think that was the best decision that I make with my husband, because the place look very simple to make me pay $130.00 per night when I pay $179.00 in Westin Rio Mar.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: Avery71
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Crow's Nest previously (several years ago) we pretty much knew what to expect. Nothing has changed much. Some good, some bad. Bad because the rooms have not been touched in terms of painting or refurbishing since our last visit, and good in that the new restaurant served nice meals and the waiters were very good in comparison to the other restaurants on the island. The hotel management really needs to do something to freshen things up around the property (buildings). The buidlings are looking run down and in need of attention - a little bit of effort would certainly enhance the visual appeal of the place. The pool and gardens at the rear are beautiful - nice to see how the grounds matured since our last visit. Pleasantly surprised that the breakfast provided was MUCH better than our first visit. There was lots of selection and it was very good. Here is my real beef about this place - in two visits (of many nights duration both times), the hotel staff were always less than friendly or attentive. It's like they don't even care you are there, or that you chose their hotel for your vacation. I always feel like I am "putting them out" by asking a simple question or mentioning something that might need to be fixed in the room (which it never was). It was a small thing, but at least an attempt to resolve would have been nice. This is why we won't be returning to the hotel for a stay on future visits and won't be recommending to our friends any longer. This is really a 2 star hotel now when I would have previously given it 3 stars. Don't get me wrong, we had a nice time - but there are just better places to stay for the price. It is too bad because this place is in a good location. But without sprucing up the rooms a little bit and considering the attitude of the management, I don't see any reason to return. There are lots of other places to stay that actually want my business.

Reviews.Title: “best trip to Vieques”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCutiepie
Reviews.Content: After driving around on the main land of Puerto Rico we saw a ad for the Bio Bays and decided we must see them before we head back to California. We decided at 4pm that day to go to Vieques. The wonderful people at the Crow's Nest made all the arrangements for the tour to the bay. We were in such a hurry we ended up having to fly because we couldn't make the ferry on time. The Crow's Nest provided the phone # to the airlines to Vieques. Because we were running late the Bio bay tour people picked us at the aiport. Needless to say the staff at Crow's Nest was wonderful!! Even our transportation the next morning back at 8am was taken care of!!! We had a short but, wonderful trip!!! We would definitely recommend The Crow's Nest to anyone who ask!!! The food was the best and staff go beyond their duties to take care of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “They met and exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Yukonc
Reviews.Content: The Crow's Nest was just what we were looking for. A quiet, intimate, relaxing atmosphere. I have not one complaint and can only offer rave reviews. Room was spacious and clean. Our room was on the second floor with a private balcony. A view of a beautiful flamboya tree being host to many hummingbirds. This guest house is set in the midst of a tropical garden very well kept and ablsolutely beautiful. I just don't see how anyone could not feel at peace here. The staff was very friendly and more than willing to answer our numerous questions and provide us with all we needed. The Crow's Nest along with all of Vieques and it's people met and exceeded all of our expectations. I will stay nowhere else when I return and I hope it will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the setting”
Reviews.Author: joellenbr
Reviews.Content: The Crow's nest was a lovely small hotel which provided roomy airconditioned rooms with kitchens, porches and a clean lovely small pool to take a dip in before going to bed. The staff was friendly and knows everything about the island. I would definitiely stay there again, and especially so if I went with family including kids or elders. it's a great value for the price, and has a warm Happy hour every Tuesday 5-7:30.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: OhioBeachBum
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in March at The Crow's Nest and really enjoyed the hotel. It's located in the middle of the island, but with a car we were less than 5 minutes from everything on the island. We had a private balcony overlooking the pool and we could see the ocean from there. The room had a kitchenette and a couch which was nice for holding all the electronics that had to be charged. Maritza and the other staff were very kind and took great care of us. The breakfast at Crow's Nest is GREAT. Bagels, bread, cereal, juice, fruit, etc. The banana bread is reason enough to stay there. The rooms here are nothing fancy, but our bed was VERY comfortable and the service was great. They provide beach towels and coolers for your use. There is a bar and restaurant on-site and they sell snacks and cold drinks in the lobby for the beach or for your room. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Great Place & Location”
Reviews.Author: midnightsailor27
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Crows Nest, really enjoyed the location and the great staff!! Hotel is very nice and well taken care of just a minutes drive from Isabell. Pool area and landscaping very well done with excellent view of ocean nice to just sit by and enjoy coffee or a cocktail in the evening. They offer free check out of beach chairs, umbrellas and coolers- very nice considering most of your time on the island will be spent on the beaches. Continental Breakfast in the morning - Juices/Coffee/Breads/Cereal. Rooms well taken care of and not dated like some hotel rooms you get stuck with- A/C units very nice also. Hotel Staff very accomadating they set up Taxis service for us on both sides of the ferry - We rented a car from Island rental which is within walking distance of Hotel and made for easy return given we got on the 6:00am ferry when we left. Overall very nice place - very reasonable and great location.. I was a little worried at first because I wanted to stay closer to Esperanza, but very happy with Choice...and would recommend to friend and family...

Reviews.Title: “friendly guesthouse, good value”
Reviews.Author: marcusandgriffin
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 nights at the Crow's Nest. It is a great value for the money. It is not super fancy - but the rooms are clean, the pool area is very pleasant with a great view & pretty landscaping, and the property is well kept up. Some rooms are nicer than others (one night at happy hour we all did a big tour of various rooms). In general the rooms in the newer building are nicer, and the rooms on the second floor are nicer than those on the first floor. There is a simple continental breakfast -- i.e. bagels, coffee, juice, and canned fruit --- but it is nice to have a little something before venturing out. The staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable about Vieques. They are totally willing to help you organize whatever you need. I traveled to Vieques as a single woman and felt very comfortable at the Crow's Nest. I met other travelers and had a great time. The only down sides to the Crow's Nest are that you need some form of transportation to get to the beaches and to either Esperanza or Isabel II (i.e. car, moped, publico, other guest) and that it is not quiet in the mornings - chickens, staff working on the property, etc. I would stay at the Crow's Nest again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: blivet
Reviews.Content: Ideally located; close to town, but far enough away to feel you were in the > forest. Property well kept and reasonably priced. Our room had a living > area/kitchenette (micro, stove, fridge, coffee maker, toaster, dishes, > flatware); bath with shower; queen bedroom, all air conditioned. Small patio outside. > First rate small restaurant open only Thurs thru Sun. Great steaks with huge > portions. > Front desk staff is second to none in courtesy, professionalism, > helpfulness. Lawrence and Maritza were key players in our favorable view of the Crow's > Nest. They can and will arrange everything you need to make your stay > comfortable and memorable. >Caution: Vieques has only three gas stations, two of which frequently run out > of gas by the weekend. Fuel resupply is by boat and may not become available > until Tuesday. > > > > >

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Friendly Spot on a Beautiful Island”
Reviews.Author: orchardst
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a wonderful extended weekend at the Crow's Nest in Vieques in March, 2006. The hotel assisted with a car rental, which was really helpful. The hotel has an honor snack bar and two restaurants. Although both were good, we enjoyed the pool-side restaurant more than the more upscale upstairs restaurant, which we visited on prime rib night. We stayed in a room with a double bed, mini-fridge and microwave. It was clean and comfortable. We often had the entire pool area to ourselves. I highly recommend this hotel as a place to unwind and enjoy island life! A warning to visitors to Vieques: there are no traffic lights, and intersections can be dangerous. Please be careful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really cute little place. Landscaping and architecture are unique. Stayed in a room w/o kitchen, minifridge was adequate. Pool is nice to lounge around, didn't go in. Breakfast was so-so. Two on premise restaurants, but both are closed certain days of the week and pretty much all restaurants/kitchens are closed at 9-9:30pm on the island. Fairly clean, very informative binders in every room, staff is nice but distant.

Reviews.Title: “Vieques in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: iraform
Reviews.Content: Like most of the other guesthouses I've stayed at or peeked into in Vieques, the Crow's Nest is better on the outside than the inside. Both my room and the room of a Crow's Nest regular ("You got the worst room in the house," he told me) were just fine - functional and clean enough. My room was good-sized for one person. It had a kitchenette with a refrigerator and microwave, a queen bed, a TV, a desk, and a small bathroom with a shower. It wasn't the kind of room you could lounge around in, but that's not why you go to Vieques anyway. The other room I saw was bigger than mine and had a little porch with a table and chair. My room was right next to the restaurants at the Crow's Nest and I could hear every clink of silverware and note of conversation. Even after the restaurants close, you can hear them cleaning up. It didn't bother me that much, but if you're sensitive to that kind of noise, be aware. The Crow's Nest has wireless internet, but neither I nor another guest there could get it to work, and we both had the same problem and were able to access the net elsewhere, which makes me think the problem was on their end (although no one there even knew how to reset the system). The strength of the Crow's Nest is its grounds. It sits on this garden-like piece of land, high up in the hills, with views of mountains on one side and the ocean on the other. The pool area is beautiful and underused. Both restaurants - a steak house in a wood cabana and an outdoor garden grill - are charming and serve pretty good food. Staff at the restaurants are overworked at times, but try to make the best of it. As in most Vieques restaurants, the staff is a blast to hang out with but maybe not what you'd call professional. Go with the flow and you'll be fine; expect New York-quality service and you'll only be frustrated. I felt well taken care of at the Crow's Nest. They set me up with a rental car and were perfectly willing to help me with any problem, or at least try. I paid $124 (total) a night smack in the middle of high season, a price that seems fair. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Way, way overrated and not very Vieques like”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Rick
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this place. It was just about the only spot on Vieques that reminded me of the all the gross American "vacation spot" things I go to Vieques for to leave behind. The bar scene was repulsive and loud. The hotel itself was more like a motel. The view was overrated. Most of all, it was noisy, noisy, noisy. Stay somewhere else on this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “The Crow's Nest rates an A++”
Reviews.Author: YellowstoneGal
Reviews.Content: Now that the US Navy has departed Vieques (except for a few who stayed behind on clean-up duty) itâ€™s a terrific option for a few days of completely casual, as-busy-or-laid-back-as-you-want R&R, especially if youâ€™re a nature lover. We bunked at the lovely Crowâ€™s Nest, which, in spite of its non-beach location, has a long-range view of the ocean and a little slice of the mother island from the pool and fabulous garden. Our large room was really more like a casita, with a complete kitchen, indoor/outdoor dining, a comfy living room and TV with exceptionally good cable (But no CNN! So who cares?), a big bed and small but well-appointed bath (shower only, but itâ€™s huge, and has a retractable clothesline for those ever-wet bathing suits.) Our room was excellently laid-out, and with first rate Puerto Rican-style ventilation â€“ two effective ceiling fans and Miami shutters on large windows for privacy and all the fresh air you need. Of course, with this island construction thereâ€™s no insulation from exterior noise, but the daytime voices of staff and guests were unobtrusive, and even at night, with both restaurants open, people were well-behaved, laughing and talking pleasantly, and everybody seems to go to bed early (which is wonderful for the sun-baked, pooped guest.) You will probably be more bothered by the crowing roosters every morning. Here the front desk and maintenance/housekeeping staff are truly warm and friendly, completely helpful and gracious about everything. They provide good quality loaner beach towels and rent snorkel gear. Thereâ€™s an honor bar in the lobby well stocked with junk food (but pick up your beer/wine at the mercado down the road, no booze in the honor bar.) They also arrange your rental car (no Hertz or Budget on this little island) which includes a free ride back to the airport, and will book tours for you. NOTE! If you want to see the bioluminescent Mosquito Bay by electric boat (the alternative is to take a kayak and swim tour â€“ which we loved, but itâ€™s only for the physically able) book way in advance â€“ maybe when you reserve your room. The bay is kept ecologically healthy by severely limiting the amount of mechanical activity out there, so the one electric boat per night fills up quickly. It is a spectacular, do-not-miss experience you can only get on Vieques. We very much enjoyed the one dinner we ate at El Jardin, the pool-side bar and restaurant (see photo.) My grilled swordfish kebob was fresh and excellent. We did not try the Steak House. The self-serve breakfast is also outdoors (in a covered area) and hard though it is to believe, the machine-dispensed coffee is quite good. Bird-watchers, take your binoculars! Sitting around the pool we watched the gray kingbirds, hummingbirds (â€œzumbadoresâ€� in Spanish) and pearly-eyed thrashers, among others. Elsewhere on the island expect to see lots of cattle egrets, other, larger egrets, frigate birds, brown pelicans, changos, and more. Back in Chicago now, 5 degrees outside, I really miss this place. Weâ€™d go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “No longer Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Crow's Nest is no longer tranquil. We visited over winter solstice during the "grand opening" of the new outdoor bar, which was unfortunately situated in the center of the courtyard facing everybody's room and terrace. If you leave you windows open at night, it is quite rowdy and loud. We used to enjoy a quiet evening/dinner on the terrace with the sounds of crickets and frogs. No longer, now we hear the bar. The free continental breakfast has also gone downhill considerably in quality. Otherwise, rooms are clean, service is good, and the restaurant is excellent. Next time, we will probably stay somewhere else on Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderfully Gorgeous Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Vieques in September because we knew that it wouldn't be crowded. We picked the Crow's Nest because of the lovely pictures we had seen and the fact that we wanted a small friendly place. It was just what we expected. The gardens are unbelievable with every kind of tropical flower and plant you can imagine. We thought of it as our own secret garden Our room was spacious, extremely clean and neat and the staff, everyone front the front desk as well as housekeeping was very pleasant. The restaurant the Island Steakhouse was a big surprise. My husband who prefers to eat only red meat considers himself a real beef afficionado. If he had a choice he would eat steak everyday. We both thought the steaks we got were some of the best we have ever had. The restaurant looks like a tree house completely surrounded by trees and vines. We really thought it was romantic. In September it seems that many of the island's restaurants close so we felt really lucky, that what must be one of the island's best restaurants remained open. We ate there several nights during our week stay. We can't say enough good things about the Crow's Nest.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As two returned Peace Corps volunteers, we are very felxible in our accomodations and choice of amenities. However, our stay at the Crow's Nest was outstanding and totally devoid of any problems or issues. We had a huge room with large bed, full kitchen, and air conditioning that kept the room comfortable cool. It was also right next to the pool. This is not a five star luxury resort chain with a spa and wait staff. What it does have is a beautiful view of the ocean, a great pool, extremely helpful staff, free continental breakfast, and a feeling of being totally "away from it all." There is a helpful car rental agency right next door, and amazing beaches are a very short drive away. If you want to experience the Carribean without Starbucks and McDonalds, book a flight to Vieques now and stay at the Crow's Nest. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here on our honeymoon in May 2004. We had the most amazing time. Even though the island as a whole is fabulous, the grounds are so enchanting it was hard to get the energy to leave. It really is a tropical wonderland. The inn itself is perched on a high hill with views of the ocean and on clear days the main island. Further, a gate to the pool area is covered in flowers and the entire grounds are beautifully landscaped. The hotel staff was also great; not at all snooty like one previous poster complained. They went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and gave us great advice on what to see and where to eat. We highly recommend a visit to the bio bay. Also it was extremely helpful having a full kitchen in our suite because I was able to make some meals and we often packed lunches for day trips to the beaches.
